Reviews.Title: Sound functionality misleading
Reviews.Author: Annmarie
Reviews.Content: Just purchased from Costco at a great price.  Picture quality is great, set-up was easy.  Paired it with a Sony Streaming box and I have a smart TV for under $350!  Only complaint is the audio.  The sound is not bad but the functionality of the XinemaSound 3D is not as advertised on the box, in the manual, or on the website.  The manual shows the ability to turn it off and on, along with a leveler.  This menu function is not available on the 32 and 37 Class, according to JVC tech support.  They claim the sound functionality is "built in", but it sounds like straight stereo sound to me - no additional depth you would expect to hear from a simulated surround sound experience.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Kilroy
Reviews.Content: Received this set 2 weeks ago. For first week only had normal non HD input from Dish satellite receiver. 480i res is what the set claimed it was getting.  Even at that the picture was great! After first week got my Dish upgrade to full HD (1080i) the picture is fantastic!!  This is the 3rd JVC I have owned. The first 2 were CRT sets and ran for over 20yrs. I am very happy I spent the extra to buy another JVC product.  The sound from this set is vastly superior to other flat screens Ive heard. You'll have no trouble hearing, the sound is comparable to my old JVCs both of which had stereo sound. Its not however a substitute for even a mediocre surround system. You'll never rattle the room with the sound coming from it. Dont let that scare you tho the sound is more than adequate for normal viewing.Only possible negative point is the stand. Easy to see how so many of these sets are knocked over. My sister has the same size Samsung and I have to admit its slightly more stable. There is a whole in the back of the base that could be used to screw it down to your entertainment center. If you have small children its something you should consider. I plan to wall mount it asap.Bottom line my family an I are VERY happy with this purchase and I highly recommend it!!!!

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly good picture and sound quality.
Reviews.Author: J. Schaffer
Reviews.Content: I don't write too many reviews, but knowing how much I make buying decisions based on reviews of others, and considering how few reviews there are about this TV, I decided to add my opinion...We purchased this TV on sale during Black Friday at a price just above what basic 32" LCDs from other manufactures were selling for.Overall, we're very happy with this TV. It was a nice upgrade to our bedroom tube TV. HD broadcasts looks stunning, DVDs look great, and even SD cable looks surprisingly clean with the Noise reduction setting on just level 1 of 3.  (Higher values make the image look too blocky).Sound is very clear as well.  Certainly not like from my 5.1 system downstairs, but perfectly fine for general TV viewing.  Also, a benefit of this TV is it has audio output jacks, so connecting to even a CD stereo is possible if you want fuller sound and you don't have an HDMI receiver.What I found during research of JVC TV's: JVC licenses the name to a 3rd party panel manufacturer. This manufacturer makes other brand TVs too, but puts their "premium" PQ and Sound Quality features into this JVC line.Pros:Great 1080p pictureSD looks really goodLots of image control optionsgood soundaudio outputsUSB input37" TV's can be hung with a wall mount using only a Single Wall Stud! (generally 40" + requires two studs). Makes hanging much simpler.Cons:Takes about 20 seconds for bulb to warm up and illuminate on start-up;No web/internet connectivity;limited information about these JVC-Branded TV's online

Reviews.Content: I bought this for the office and its great I just love it, great picture and sound, its all in all a great purchase

Reviews.Title: Great TV! Great Price!!

Reviews.Content: Bought this for our bedroom and we love it.  I have noticed it a little slower powering on, but I don't mind. Price was great so I'm not complaining.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Julie Johnson "jujo"
Reviews.Content: After much research, and being swayed by the reviews, I ordered this tv.  Very happy with picture quality, but sound quality is hugely disappointing.  Have to set it at 70 before a comfortable listening level in a 14x12 bedroom.  My friend just today set up an Insignia brand 39" led.  I think the picture of the JVC is fAR superior, but the audio on her tv is LOUD at only 20---clearly, the speakers on the JVC are inferior.

Reviews.Title: 37" TV FOR UNDER 300? GET IT!
Reviews.Author: R. Pace
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv right away after reading the reviews on this site and wallmart.com in which all were on the money.I only have a couple of nit-picks about the set.One:The mount is very thin if you are planning to mount it on a flat surface, they should have made on with a higher impact plastic one. Don't let it dicourage you, it will be fine as long asit's kept secure away from traffic.Two:The arrows near the ok button on the remote are very close so when you try to hit the arrow for up, down, left or right, you'll hit the ok button and it's annoying.Three:The input selection doesn't dispay for too long like the menu so you have to make your selection fast.Other than those three minor things, this is a good tv so I'll give it four stars. There are plenty of bells and whistles for adjustments and I'm very pleased with it.I paid 279. at wallmart.com which is unheard of for a 37" and it's holding up great. I called customer service to walk me through the set-up and they were so helpful and patient. Get this tv but keep in mind that it has only one HDMI input. If that's not a problem you'll hit a homerun with this purchase.I'll update as time goes by. If you see nothing, all is well. Go for it!Note: A thing I learned from customer service is if you hit the okay button and then press in 2589, you have the option of refreshing the tv. Go with the first choice, not the second.

Reviews.Title: JVC/A very good company

Reviews.Content: I received this tv a short time ago and working just fine. The picture quality and sound are good.I will review this again in three months for an update.

After taking it out and removing the packaging it appeared to be okay.  My husband connected it without the HD box and the picture was alright, but when connected to HD the picture was great.  So far everything looks great!  Great picture and sound....
